title: Lohan Ratwatte remanded
byline: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte who was arrested by police, has been remanded until November 07 by the Nugegoda Additional Magistrate.

title: Kenya’s new deputy president to be sworn in
byline: The softly spoken Kithure Kindiki is due to be sworn in as Kenya’s new deputy president on Friday, after senators ousted Rigathi Gachagua in a dramatic series of impeachment votes a fortnight ago.

title: Two students killed, 40 injured in bus accident
byline: At least two female students were killed and 40 others were injured after a bus carrying university students overturned after colliding with a bund on the Badulla-Mahiyangana main road this morning.

title: Couple arrested with 54 kilos of heroin in Sevanagala
byline: A couple has been arrested by the Police Special Task Force (STF) at Kiriwewa in Sevanagala along with nearly 54 kilos of heroin valued at Rs. 2,000 million.

title: Security detail for Mahinda Rajapaksa reduced to 60 personnel
byline: The security personnel assigned to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has been reduced to 60, official sources said

title: 16 politically appointed ambassadors, high commissioners to be recalled with immediate effect
byline: The government has decided to recall 16 political appointees serving as ambassadors and high commissioners of Sri Lanka’s overseas missions with immediate effect, a Foreign Ministry source said yesterday.

title: Govt clarifies Arugam Bay incident as organized crime, not extremism
byline: The government in a meeting with US embassy officials in Colombo on Wednesday has reportedly ruled out any links between the recent incident in Arugam Bay and ‘extremism’, categorizing it instead as an incident of ‘organized crime’.

title: Chennai Super Kings retain Matheesha Pathirana for INR 13 crore
byline: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) have retained Sri Lankan pacer Matheesha Pathirana for a staggering INR 13 crore, equivalent to approximately USD 1.56 million ahead of the IPL player auction.

title: Palali-Achchuveli Road reopens after 30 years
byline: The Palali–Achchuveli main road in the Northern Province reopened today (01), after being closed for more than three decades.

title: Fire breaks out at vehicle garage in Rajagiriya
byline: A major fire was reported at a vehicle garage in Obeysekarapura, Rajagiriya and the Kotte Fire Brigade has dispatched several fire trucks to control the blaze.

title: Ranil could make a comeback: Rajitha
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe could make a comeback as people may start looking up to him in the event of another economic crisis which looks to be a possibility, former MP and New Democratic Front (NDF) Kalutara District candidate Dr. Rajitha Senaratne said.

title: Another jeep suspected to belong to Lohan Ratwatte seized
byline: The Theldeniya police seized a suspicious jeep with a forged number plate, allegedly used by former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte.

title: SJB’s Lihini Fernando calls on Lal Kantha to apologise over derogatory remarks
byline: Condemning the statement by NPP member Lal Kantha over SJB Kandy District candidate Chamindrani Kiriella, SJB National List candidate Lihini Fernando said Lal Kantha must tender a public apology to Chamindrani in for his derogatory remarks on a woman.

title: Sri Lankan dies during immigration check in Malaysia
byline: A Sri Lankan man died after falling from a pedestrian bridge connecting JB Sentral and Sultan Iskandar Building during an immigration check on Thursday.

title: Bitter history of strikes will end under NPP government: Lakshman Nipuna Arachchi
byline: The bitter history of strikes will end under the National People’s Power (NPP) government where it will be a thing of the past, NPP candidate Lakshman Nipuna Arachchi said.

title: Australia cricket team to tour Sri Lanka in early 2025
byline: The Australia Men’s National Cricket Team will tour Sri Lanka from January to February 2025 to participate in a two-match Test series and one ODI.

title: Arrest warrant against Johnston Fernando recalled by Court
byline: The Colombo High Court today recalled the arrest warrant issued against former Minister Johnston Fernando after he appeared before court.

title: TISL raises concern over violation of election laws through new appointments
byline: Transparency International Sri Lanka (TISL) has filed a formal complaint with the Election Commission of Sri Lanka (ECSL) regarding the recent appointments made at the Palmyrah Development Board (PDB) in Jaffna, which appear to contravene current election laws.

title: Kenya’s new deputy president to be sworn in
byline: The softly spoken Kithure Kindiki is due to be sworn in as Kenya’s new deputy president on Friday, after senators ousted Rigathi Gachagua in a dramatic series of impeachment votes a fortnight ago.

title: Van-lorry collision injures 20 on Radella Loop
byline: A collision between a van and a lorry on the Radella Loop, just off the Hatton-Nuwara Eliya main road, left twenty persons injured, police said.

title: Ministers will not be given houses in Colombo: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said recently that ministers will not be given houses in Colombo claiming that they must go to villages and attend to people’s issues.

title: President’s office denies reports on reduced security for MR
byline: The Government refuted recent media claims suggesting a reduction in the security detail provided to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: Immigration dept. to launch online passport appointment system
byline: The Department of Immigration and Emigration has announced plans to introduce an online appointment system for passport applications, set to launch in the coming weeks.

title: Government to digitise paddy storage system
byline: A discussion on the digitalisation of social welfare benefit programmes took place (01) under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, where the significance of digitising the paddy storage system was also discussed.

title: Thundershowers, lightning on the cards in several provinces
byline: Heavy rainfall exceeding 100 mm is forecast in parts of the Central, Sabaragamuwa, Uva, and North-Central Provinces, with atmospheric conditions expected to bring afternoon thundershowers across much of the island.

title: Dr. Hans Wijayasuriya appointed President’s chief advisor on digital economy
byline: Dr. Hans Wijayasuriya has been appointed as the Chief Advisor to the President on Digital Economy, the Presidential Media Division (PMD) announced.
